pets.name: Colby
pets.summaryHtml:
Meet Colby!
Owner surrender (his former family-an older couple-couldn't keep up with his very high energy). Previously arrived via police after an eviction case, and was adopted before being returned for mouthiness and activity needs.

My Ideal Home
Active, experienced, adult-only home that enjoys training and daily exercise. Think: long, structured walks, decompression time, and plenty of enrichment (sniffy outings, food puzzles, tug with rules, flirt pole). Consistency + positive reinforcement will help him channel his enthusiasm.

Good with Kids?
Recommended adult-only (no children under 13) per behavior team.

Good with Other Pets?
History suggests he can be playful with some dogs, but shelter notes show over-arousal/kennel reactivity and tense gate greets. No dog parks. If you have a resident dog, plan slow, structured introductions (parallel walks, breaks, supervision). Cats: unknown.

Leash Manners
Strong, eager walker who pulls hard at times; a front-clip harness or head halter plus reward-based loose-leash practice is recommended. He may react to small animals and fast movers (squirrels, birds, bikes, skateboards)-build focus with "let's go" and treat-and-retreat games.

Overall Health
Neutered, approximately 50 lbs. Vet intake: apparently healthy. Housebroken per previous owner. As with any newly adopted dog, your vet can personalize his wellness plan.

Behavior Determination & Other
ACC Behavior Level: 3
Potential challenges noted: mouthiness/rough treat-taking, jumping up, strength/leash pulling, resource guarding of high-value or "found" objects, handling sensitivity when over-aroused, on-leash reactivity to small animals/moving objects, and stress in/around crates or close quarters with other dogs.
Recommendations: adult-only home, no dog parks, use management (front-clip harness, baby gates, tethered settle), trade-up for any item in his mouth (never grab), and practice default cues ("sit," "off," "find it") to build impulse control.

Fun Facts
Volunteers call him "easy-going, happy, WONDERFUL" with joyful prancing and a stellar sit for treats. He loves park sniffs, sunbathing at your feet, and-best of all-being part of the action with his people.

If you're up for training and tons of fun with a smart, athletic sidekick, Colby is ready to be your adventure buddy!

My boroughbreaker writes: We took a walk around Central Park and did a little sunbathing at the conservatory! He has a lot of energy and is super eager to sniff everything he can. The bustle of the city street was a little overstimulating for him, but once we got to sit down away from cars, runners, and bikes, he was very chill and started looking for pets, snuggles, and kisses. He really loved getting some time in the grass and leaves. Once you've established some trust, he happily responds to sit, paw, and lie down (for treats).

Strong, eager walker who pulls hard at times; a front-clip harness or head halter plus reward-based loose-leash practice is recommended. He may react to small animals and fast movers (squirrels, birds, bikes, skateboards)-build focus with "let's go" and treat-and-retreat games.

Overall Health
Neutered, approximately 50 lbs. Vet intake: apparently healthy. Housebroken per previous owner. As with any newly adopted dog, your vet can personalize his wellness plan.

Behavior Determination & Other
ACC Behavior Level: 3
Potential challenges noted: mouthiness/rough treat-taking, jumping up, strength/leash pulling, resource guarding of high-value or "found" objects, handling sensitivity when over-aroused, on-leash reactivity to small animals/moving objects, and stress in/around crates or close quarters with other dogs.
Recommendations: adult-only home, no dog parks, use management (front-clip harness, baby gates, tethered settle), trade-up for any item in his mouth (never grab), and practice default cues ("sit," "off," "find it") to build impulse control.

Fun Facts
Volunteers call him "easy-going, happy, WONDERFUL" with joyful prancing and a stellar sit for treats. He loves park sniffs, sunbathing at your feet, and-best of all-being part of the action with his people.

If you're up for training and tons of fun with a smart, athletic sidekick, Colby is ready to be your adventure buddy!

My boroughbreaker writes: We took a walk around Central Park and did a little sunbathing at the conservatory! He has a lot of energy and is super eager to sniff everything he can. The bustle of the city street was a little overstimulating for him, but once we got to sit down away from cars, runners, and bikes, he was very chill and started looking for pets, snuggles, and kisses. He really loved getting some time in the grass and leaves. Once you've established some trust, he happily responds to sit, paw, and lie down (for treats).

pets.name: Cookie
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I am excitable and energetic! I will need positive outlets for my energy!

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

pets.name: Coopster
pets.summaryHtml:
My boroughbreaker writes: Coopster is a perfect Pit for pajamas. After a long walk, he would love to just snuggle up and enjoy your presence. He is a beautiful treat motivated young dog whose head is the size of his heart. On leash, he usually stays to one side and pulls unintentionally as he is a big dog. If you stop in your tracks, he will slow down. He wants desperately to play with other dogs and will do so with a wiggly body, but was not allowed. With a bit of training, Coopster is a perfect dog. My boroughbreaker writes: Coopster was really good! He jumped a lot when we first started but stopped after a few minutes. He met two of my friends later on and jumped on them but only once. He definitely pulls hard on the leash and gets very excited when he sees other dogs. All around a very sweet dog, always on the watch.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I will flourish in a calm environment and a low-traffic home.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

A Volunteer Wrote: Not only will this gorgeous hunk give you his paw, he'll let you hold it as long as you'd like, and then he will lean into you and look up with his giant brown eyes, just waiting to be pet. Because Coopster's favorite thing in the whole world is to be showered with affection, something the staff here is happy to do until you come adopt him. We're rooting for this beautiful baby and know you will be, too, once you meet him at Manhattan!

pets.name: Dakota
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes:

Affectionate, curious and caring, Dakota has it all.

Fully housetrained, Dakota can be left alone for several hours on her own without any risk of incident.

Dakota loves everyone. She came to ACC after getting glowing reviews from her previous home, one that included multiple adults, children and other dogs. She has also done well when subsequently being introduced to cats in a foster setting.

She wants to know what you're thinking and will cutely tilt her head when you speak. And she will attentively play with various toys, while also listening to commands like "sit", "paw" and "down". She will let you know when she wants to receive some affection with gentle pawing or resting her head nearby or on your knee.

On walks, she can be excitable on leash when passing larger dogs within tight settings because of her loyalty, but the rest of the time she's as docile as can be. She is excellent in the open space of the dog park, and even comes to the defense of other dogs when they are being bullied. While she has high energy when outside, she is very relaxed inside the home.

If you're looking for a jogging companion, Dakota is happy to run alongside you. You can see in her profile she enjoys running along the water and even on NYC bridges. She also is great in a car and loves a good hiking experience for outdoor recreation.

Dakota is super cute and happy to get dressed up in various outfits. She is a big fan of the Giants, Yankees, Knicks and Rangers, and she doesn't hate the Jets and Mets. She's allegiant but would be open to adopting a new team. She's also happy to wear festive holiday attire. Even without the outfits, she gets lots of compliments while on walks just for being who she is.

She may take a small amount of time to warm up to new people, but once she does, she will love you forever. While she was living with children in her previous home, she has yet to be introduced to children in a household setting since being fostered.

She of course loves to be pet and encouraged, but Dakota also really enjoys a "spa day" in the bathtub and getting belly rubs. And she appreciates her beauty sleep (and it's been working!). On a typical day, Dakota will sleep in until being woken up, sometimes even late into the morning. She is typically curled up on the couch and happy to be pet as she is waking up. Then she is patient as her caretaker is getting ready themselves while waiting to be given breakfast and go out for her first walk.

Dakota is truly ready to breathe life into a fresh home and can't wait to be a great addition to her new family!

pets.name: Deuce
pets.summaryHtml:
Deuce is a curious and food-driven pup enrolled in our Shelter Scholars program, where he's working on reducing his instinct to scavenge. Through enrichment, structured training, and redirection techniques, Deuce is learning to ignore tempting street snacks and focus instead on his handler. He's making impressive strides toward becoming a more focused and mindful companion.

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

pets.name: Deva
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Deva is a sweet, gentle, and incredibly friendly dog who has settled into foster life beautifully. In just a week, she has shown us how easygoing, affectionate, and people-loving she is. She's fully house-trained and very calm inside the home. Deva gets along wonderfully with everyone she meets - she loves strangers and quickly becomes the center of attention wherever she goes. We haven't introduced her to children yet, but based on her overall temperament, we expect she'd do just fine. Outside, Deva is a dream to walk. She may start out a bit excited, but she quickly relaxes and strolls beside you on a loose leash. She enjoys sniffing around but listens well when her name is called. She's also been non-reactive to wildlife and small animals - even when she spotted deer upstate, she simply watched them quietly without barking. She knows "sit" and "paw," and we suspect she'll pick up new cues easily. At home, Deva is comfortable being left alone for a few hours. She settles quickly in her crate, usually curling up and falling asleep. If there's a lickmat in her cage - that's a real treat for her! She's a very quiet dog and rarely barks or vocalizes. Deva would fit into almost any home. She loves attention and affection but isn't needy or overly energetic. She's content with a few walks a day, some play time with her toys and plenty of cozy downtime. She has some mild skin allergies that cause her to occasionally lick or nibble her paws, but otherwise she's very easy to care for. She also has the cutest quirks - one floppy ear that gets constant compliments, a little strut when she walks, and big soulful eyes that will absolutely melt your heart. Deva is a gentle, loving, and low-maintenance dog who is ready to bring joy and warmth to her forever family.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I am a sweet, social, older gal, looking for the perfect forever home!

I am finding the shelter a bit overwhelming. Outside one-on-one I am a great big cuddle bug.

My #BoroughBreak Buddy writes: This was my first time ever doing a borough break, and Deva couldn't have been more perfect for it. She was such a good and well-behaved girl. Like any dog who's been in the shelter, she was naturally curious about the outside world, but she handled everything calmly and beautifully. While we were out, it was inevitable that we'd pass by other dogs, but Deva did amazing. She never pulled on the leash, and whenever we approached another dog, we both paused and kept our distance. She would look up at me and mirror my behavior, and once I gave her the okay to continue walking, she happily picked up our stroll again. She's an incredibly sweet dog who loves her head scratches, and anyone who adopts her will truly be such a lucky owner. Spending time with her was a joy, and I'm grateful I got to share the afternoon with her.

pets.name: Didgeridoo
pets.summaryHtml:
My borough breaker writes: Didgeridoo was great all day! He was so sweet and friendly as soon as he met me. He did not jump at all. He pulled a little when he saw other dogs or squirrels but with some redirection, he was back on track. We had a great day and he was so well behaved. Anyone would be so lucky to have Didgeridoo as a member of their family!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I am playful and cute!

I will need daily physical activity to keep me healthy and happy!
pets.description_html:
My borough breaker writes: Didgeridoo was great all day! He was so sweet and friendly as soon as he met me. He did not jump at all. He pulled a little when he saw other dogs or squirrels but with some redirection, he was back on track. We had a great day and he was so well behaved. Anyone would be so lucky to have Didgeridoo as a member of their family!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I am playful and cute!

I will need daily physical activity to keep me healthy and happy!

pets.name: Difference
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Lively, lovable, and laid-back, Difference is the ultimate city pup! This curious cutie loves exploring, socializing, and snuggling up with his favorite people. With a heart of gold and a low-maintenance vibe, Difference is perfect for active owners who want a loyal companion to share in their adventures. As a social butterfly, he thrives around new people and is always up for a walk or a new escapade. But what really sets Difference apart? He's incredibly well-behaved, with impeccable manners - even when tempted with food! You can leave a plate of treats right in front of him, and he'll politely decline. Plus, he's a quiet companion, never barking to disturb the peace. Making him the perfect apartment dog! Potty-trained, calm around strangers, and eager to please, Difference is ready to bring joy and excitement to his forever family. If you're looking for a laid-back buddy to keep you company on all your adventures, Difference might be the perfect fit for you!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

pets.name: Dolly
pets.summaryHtml:
The Foster Writes
Dolly- affectionate, adorable, with ears that stop people in their tracks! A pocket sized bundle of joy who loves strangers and cuddles. Dolly is a super star in the house- calm, cool and always wanting to be near the person she loves. She is a very nervous nelly when she ventures outside into the big scary world, but once she is back indoors, she will melt your heart with her perfection! She loves to play fetch and then snooze next to her humans. Dolly would do best in a single dog family, with someone who is willing to let her get close during the cold winter nights and ease her worries away. We rate Dolly A+ in her human and snuggle skills.

pets.name: Doug
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Doug is curious and enjoys long walk. At home, he loves snuggle, naps and dog tv. He is calm, potty-trained and never barks. He is a sweet boy and a very good company.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I am a sweet, social, older gentleman, looking for the perfect forever home!

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

I'll need daily interaction with you as I get used to my new life.

A volunteer writes: If there's one thing we hate to see it's seniors in the shelter. 10 year old Doug deserves all the luxuries that come with a life long lived: warm beds, delicious treats, and naps in the sunshine, amongst many other things. Each time we pass his kennel, Doug is laying on his bed, a humble guy, not too noisy, not too pushy. He's a leisurely walker, a gentle treat taker, and a cuddly boy in an unassuming way. His giant ears may not be as in tune as they have in the past, his gait a little slower, his muzzle a bit whiter. He's walkable by our newest volunteers which means he's a very good and easy boy. Our behavior team has even deemed him adoptable by even novice families. Doug has been mostly aloof and avoidant of other dogs. If there's one thing we love to see, it's seniors leaving the shelter. So come to Queens ACC to meet him today!

I can be slow to adjust to new environments. I prefer to take things at my own pace.

pets.name: Dream
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Hi future furever family, my name is Dream! I am the sweetest and most loving girl there ever was. I enjoy walks in the neighborhood, playing with my toys, and especially enjoy a good game of tug of war. I am potty trained but need some continued support on walking outside without pulling on my leash. I love enjoying a yummy lick mat while you watch your favorite show. I am content to either sleep in my own bed or yours as long as we are in the same room. I absolutely love cuddling & making sure you know how much I love you.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

pets.name: Dutchess
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Dutchess is the sweetest, smartest lady. She wants to be with her person all the time but will happily snooze in her crate if you're busy. Just give her a treat and tell her she's pretty and she'll love you right back.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I lived with children in my previous home.

I need a home without cats or small animals.

I need a home where there are no other dogs.

I have been known to shower my favorite people in love!

I am finding the shelter a bit overwhelming. Outside one-on-one I am a great big cuddle bug.

I can be slow to adjust to new environments. I prefer to take things at my own pace.

I am playful and cute!

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

My boroughbreaker writes: Dutchess was scared at first but warmed up and had a really fun day! She enjoyed treats and pets and enjoyed quiet time on the couch. She was sweet, gentle, and calm. A Volunteer Wrote: We hate it when we see a dog back in the shelter for the second time, and all the more so when they are older, and most of all when they are as extraordinary as Dutchess, who has lived peaceably with cats, dogs, and children. She's taking being back here in remarkable stride, always happy to see the staff and volunteers and so eager to accept our displays of affection, which we lavish on his loving, gentle girl. But there's only so much that can be done in a loud, overcrowded shelter, and this remarkable soul has so earned a home to call her own for the rest of her life!

pets.name: Dyno
pets.summaryHtml:
Meet Dyno!
Surrendered to ACC, Dyno has shown himself to be a bright, eager learner who loves being near his people. He soaks up praise, enjoys enrichment games, and settles nicely once he understands the routine.

My Ideal Home
I'll thrive with experienced adopters who enjoy training and structure. A calm, adult household that can help me build confidence, practice predictable routines, and give me daily outlets for my brain and body will help me be my best self.

Good with Kids?
Best in an adults-only home. I can be sensitive to handling and need slow, thoughtful introductions, so no children under 13 for me right now.

Good with Other Pets?
In a prior home I reportedly lived with other large dogs and could be relaxed and playful. In the care center I've shown mixed reactions at the gate. I'd do best as the only dog to start, or with very slow, well-managed introductions to a calm, compatible dog. No known cat history.

Leash Manners
I'm strong and can pull when excited, especially around dogs or new sights. I'm responding well to reward-based games (engage/disengage, "1-2-3," check-ins) and settle into a looser leash with coaching. A front-clip harness and consistent positive reinforcement will set me up for success.

Overall Health
Healthy overall. I recovered from a routine upper-respiratory bug earlier in my stay and I'm feeling good now. Neutered and ready for my next chapter.

Behavior Determination
Level 3 - Adults Only: I warm up with treats and time, but can be handling-sensitive and may get over-aroused on leash. I'll thrive with patient adopters who use positive reinforcement, give me choice and space, and help me practice calm behaviors.

Other Fun Facts
I lean in for scritches, offer sits to "ask nicely," and love puzzle feeders and sniffari walks. I'm equal parts athlete and cuddle bug-looking for a teammate to keep me smart, busy, and loved.

pets.name: Echo
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Echo is a super sweet dog that just wants to cuddle. He loves to play and will try to involve you if he can. He is smart and well-mannered once he knows the expectations. He loves squirrels, birds, and will actually drop the ball for fetch. When Echo is in your life, he will be YOUR dog. He wants to protect you more than he wants to protect himself. He would likely do decently well at a dog park as he loves to run around/run with the pack. Anyone would be lucky to have Echo. My other foster writes: Meet this handsome boy who will steal your heart! Echo is an affectionate sweetheart who loves nothing more than following you around for pets, nudging you for attention, and laying by your side just to be near you. He's a great listener who follows directions beautifully - he knows, off, no, stop, quiet, sit, come, and responds to his name. His leash manners continue to improve tremendously. This playful pup has endless positive energy for tug of war and fetch, greeting you with the world's most enthusiastic tail wags and biggest smiles. Strangers constantly stop to compliment how gorgeous he is! He's the most excited dog in the world when you come home, expressing pure joy and abundant affection for the people he loves. Looking for an active companion who will shower you with love and keep you smiling? Echo is your guy!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

A Volunteer Wrote: One volunteer sums this wonderful boy up as "magic." He's the best company on a stroll or hanging in the back, playing with fallen leaves, sharing treats, and sneaking in as many cuddles as possible. The person who found Echo as a stray says he is very well behaved and very well trained, and we couldn't agree more! He doesn't care about other dogs on the street, appears housetrained, and walks like a pro on the leash, He has stolen all of our hearts, including that of one staff member who would like to add that Echo loves bird watching. You know what he'd love most of all? To go home with you!
pets.description_html:
My foster writes: Echo is a super sweet dog that just wants to cuddle. He loves to play and will try to involve you if he can. He is smart and well-mannered once he knows the expectations. He loves squirrels, birds, and will actually drop the ball for fetch. When Echo is in your life, he will be YOUR dog. He wants to protect you more than he wants to protect himself. He would likely do decently well at a dog park as he loves to run around/run with the pack. Anyone would be lucky to have Echo. My other foster writes: Meet this handsome boy who will steal your heart! Echo is an affectionate sweetheart who loves nothing more than following you around for pets, nudging you for attention, and laying by your side just to be near you. He's a great listener who follows directions beautifully - he knows, off, no, stop, quiet, sit, come, and responds to his name. His leash manners continue to improve tremendously. This playful pup has endless positive energy for tug of war and fetch, greeting you with the world's most enthusiastic tail wags and biggest smiles. Strangers constantly stop to compliment how gorgeous he is! He's the most excited dog in the world when you come home, expressing pure joy and abundant affection for the people he loves. Looking for an active companion who will shower you with love and keep you smiling? Echo is your guy!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

pets.name: Eggo
pets.summaryHtml:
There is an adorable video of me on ACC's TikTok page. Click here to experience the cuteness!

Here's how I've been doing in a foster home! Click here to see!



My foster writes: Hello all my name is Eggo and im happy that you stopped by to read my bio. I am a 4 year old mixed breed dog and my history is a mystery. I am a loving and caring dog who enjoys learnimg new things, being in the company of others and exploring new places while out on walks. I enjoy eating frozen treats mostly frozen sugar free applesauce, peanut butter and sunflower butter. I also like to have lap time while I watch TV, and letting to audio. I like to play with my toys alone but. im learning how to share. What I REALLY LOVE is Zoomy time!!!!! I get along well with teenagers and adults who have a lot of patience. Once I'm use to you I enjoy tummy rubs and scratches behind my ear.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I have medical needs that staff will address with you when you meet me.

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

Please check here for updated adoption hours.

pets.name: Eleanor
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet needs emergency placement. Please click here to go to our emergency placement page for more information.

This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Eleanor is at risk due to behavioral reasons. Eleanor has been observed to be highly fearful during her stay in the care center. Noted to be at the back of the kennel with a tense body, tucked tail and showing whale eye. She is also noted to escalate to lifting her lip, hard barking, thrashing, snapping and vocalizing when handlers are attempting to leash her. While outside of kennel Eleanor is obsvered to remain fearful and will thrash intensely at times. With select handlers Eleanor is observed to be receptive to treats and takes them gently. Medically, Eleanor has a wound. Eleanor has allowed minimal handling since arriving at the care centers, she has displayed high levels of fear, anxiety and stress and has escalated to growling on a few occasions during interactions. She is avoidant of leashing and trembles while outside and has difficulty settling. Eleanor is highly food motivated however and responds to gentle coaxing from handlers with a consistent and calm approach. We recommend placement with a New Hope rescue partner who is able to provide an experienced, adult-only foster home. Force-free, reward based training and/or consultation with a professional trainer/behaviorist is highly recommended.

pets.name: Ellie
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

pets.name: Elma
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I have medical needs that staff will address with you when you meet me.

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

A Volunteer Wrote: We could learn so much from the resilience of dogs. Take our beloved Elma, who arrived at the shelter absolutely terrified by whatever awful things has happened to her before she got here. But within days, the volunteers were chattering: "She's so endlessly loving!" "What an energetic, sweet girl!" And "what a fun, exuberant, affectionate girl!" Elma also adores treats and she's been learning to sit in return for them...we were thinking maybe you could take over the training from here on out? You'd be in for such a treat yourself!

pets.name: Falsetto
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Falsetto was returned to the Care Centers due to behavior concerns. His previous adopter noted that he is mouthy, may snap when restrained, can be destructive, and often stares at other dogs. During his first stay, another dog bit him, which led to him biting a volunteer while being held. In the Care Centers, he remains social with staff. Falsetto should be placed in an adult-only home through a New Hope Partner who will use positive reinforcement to manage his behavior. My Borough Break Buddy Wrote: On our Borough Break, we spent the whole day exploring! We started by walking over the bridge to Randall's island. While Falsetto initially pulled on the leash, after a few firm "hey!s" when he reached the end of his leash and a treat to redirect him back to me, he got much better at keeping the leash loose! After exploring the island, we walked across the East Side to Central Park. On our way, Falsetto passed plenty of dogs without pulling. Once in the park, he started pulling a bit more toward other dogs but was easily redirected with either a treat or a "come on, boy!" He never pulled toward squirrels/birds. When we took breaks, Falsetto was all about cuddles, head scratches, and belly rubs. But once he got his fill, he was happy to sit between my legs and watch the people pass. My boroughbreaker writes: Went to Central Park and Harlem Meer where we had a picnic on the grass. Falsetto loved playing with a stuffy toy and enjoying a peanut butter chew. We then walked around the conservatory garden where he stopped to smell the flowers and garnered attention from park goers. Falsetto showed little-to-no reaction towards other dogs. When there were smaller dogs, he tensed up but I redirected him by saying "come here, boy!" Falsetto also enjoyed hoisting himself up the bedrocks and grabbing small branches. He rubbed himself against us and was super affectionate. For lunch, we dined at the Barking Dog restaurant where we sat outside. I was impressed on how unbothered he was with busy foot traffic and loud construction noise. He enjoyed a burger patty from the dog menu and sat patiently as we ate. He was very well-behaved and chilled the whole time. A Volunteer Wrote: Falsetto has never met a stranger he didn't love, and a stranger has never not loved Falsetto: Plan an extra ten minutes for what would usually be a brisk walk around the block for all the stops and attention and tail wagging and greetings! Volunteers adore him, praising his ease on a leash, his love of treats and snuggles, his lack of reactivity to other dogs on a leash, and his all-around sweetness. Falsetto is an absolute dream, dreaming of no longer spending his days and nights in a kennel.

pets.name: Famous
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

I need a home where there are no other dogs.

I need a home without cats or small animals.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

Not only do I pull at heart strings, but I also pull on leash! I will need someone to help me with my leash manners.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

pets.name: Flake
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet needs emergency placement. Please click here to go to our emergency placement page for more information.

This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Flake is on the at-risk list due to behavior concerns. Flake has shown persistent kennel reactivity, repeatedly hard barking with a tense body, pinned ears, and whale eyes when approached. He retreats during leashing attempts and must be slowly coaxed with high value food to place his head into the loop, sometimes pawing at the leash once secured. Outside of the kennel, he remains cautious and low bodied, intermittently refusing treats. Medically, Flake is apparently healthy. Flake came into the care center as a stray, so his history in a home environment is unknown. Flake has displayed significant fear-based and defensive behavior within the care center, particularly at the kennel front. He is frequently observed hard barking, with a tense body, pinned ears, whale eyes, and retreating when approached. He has shown reluctance and avoidance during leashing attempts, requiring slow low-pressure approaches. Once outside the kennel environment, Flake's behavior softens. He is able to walk on leash, relieve himself, and explore the yard with a cautious but improving body posture. While initially avoidant of petting and hesitant to take food, he has shown moments of social engagement, such as slowly approaching the handler, sitting beside them, and leaning in for contact. Flake will need a New Hope partner comfortable working with fearful, undersocialized dogs who show potential for defensive aggression under pressure.

pets.name: Flower
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Flower is a chill, lovable pup who just wants to hang out and be adored. She loves attention and will happily follow you around to make sure she's not missing out. Not super into snuggles, but totally into belly rubs and head scratches. Her favorite hobbies? Napping, playing with toys, and being your #1 fan. She's mellow, sweet, and easy to have around. Whether you're working, relaxing, or doing chores, Flower will be right there with you. She's ready to bring some calm, happy vibes to her forever home!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I'll need daily interaction with you as I get used to my new life.

I am playful and cute!

I will need daily physical activity to keep me healthy and happy!

pets.name: Foreign
pets.summaryHtml:
Foreign is a smart and determined pup in our Shelter Scholars program, working to overcome on-leash reactivity. With the use of positive reinforcement, engagement exercises, and leash management strategies, she's learning to keep her cool and check in with her handler when distractions appear. Foreign is proving just how capable she is with each session.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I am excitable and energetic! I will need positive outlets for my energy!

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

pets.name: Foxtrot
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I will need appropriate toys and positive outlets for my energy.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

My boroughbreaker writes: Foxtrot started off our day bursting with energy, and that energy dialed up to 11 when we got to the park and he touched grass for the first time. You could tell he wanted nothing more than to sprint and play, but his pulling became very strong, so we stuck to pavement. Foxtrot pulled moderately for our first hour but gradually started to lose steam and walk loose leash. Foxtrot does not appear to be treat motivated (although it may just be he didn't like the treats I was offering), so I couldn't keep him focused on me purely by using treats. Foxtrot was well mannered when passing dogs of all sizes and didn't show interest in squirrels or small birds, although he was somewhat curious about geese. While he didn't react to loud noises on the street, Foxtrot did get nervous when a larger dog started barking in his direction. At the time, we were sitting on a park bench, and he hugged my legs and trembled until the dog passed. We then resumed our walk, and he didn't display any more fear reactions. Foxtrot is a beautiful and sensitive dog who will seek the comfort and support of his owner. If you are a patient owner who can provide him with consistent physical and mental exercise and have the patience to work on his resource guarding, you are going to get a loving and loyal dog in return! A Volunteer Wrote: "Prepare yourself for unbearable cuteness," warned the video of Foxtrot that was sent to me before I met him. Even so, there is no preparing for this cutest, waggiest boy! Foxtrot, who has previously lived with a child, has shown his playful side to everyone at the shelter, including other dogs. His precious owner said Foxtrot's only sad when he's left alone, but this is so a dog worth sticking around for! Please, won't you come and be his forever buddy?

pets.name: Genesis
pets.summaryHtml:
A volunteer writes: This sweet floppy-eared girl is Genesis, and she's quite the little charmer. On our first walk together, she excitedly ran up to her kennel door as I opened it, full of wags and wiggles. Being a young, energetic pup, I took her to the play-yard, and boy, did she have fun! We played her version of fetch, in which she happily chases the ball, gallops back to me, then plops down and gets to work chewing away at it. I tried a toy too and she lounged out on the grass and entertained herself by pulling it apart. I think the only thing she loves more is getting lots of pets, especially having her ears and back scratched...she leans in and does these cute little wiggle-dances, with her tail happily swishing around. She was also friendly and social with staff during her Intake, Medical Exam, and Behavior Assessment.

Though we don't know Genesis' history, she's had some training - she knows "sit" and "shake", takes treats nicely, and seems to be housebroken. At the shelter, Genesis has shown distress when passing other dogs and during doggie playgroup and therefore, it's recommended that she avoid dog parks at this time. You can meet this very sweet, affectionate pup at the Queens shelter where's she patiently awaiting her fur-ever home.

pets.name: Gucci
pets.summaryHtml: Gucci arrived at MACC as a stray with no known history. During his stay in the care center Gucci has been observed to be highly fearful. Noted to growl and bare teeth with raised hackles towards handalers when they attempt to leash him. Out of kennel Gucci remains tense and head whips towards the handler when they attempt to clip their leash. Due to the detailed behaviors we recommend an experienced adult only home.

pets.name: Gusto
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Gusto is the most curious pup I've ever met! He is always sniffing everything around him and he loves to explore! He also has the cutest little prance when we go on walks. His hips wag along with his tail and if you scratch his butt when he's walking he zooms along with his tail wagging. He is the gentlest dog i've ever met. When he takes a treat he sniffs it for a while before gently opening his mouth and taking it. He also loves to snuggle. You can hug him when he's laying with you and within minutes he'll be snoring louder than ever right in your ear! He is the best pup and I can't wait for him to have a forever home!

Gusto (210637) has been the perfect first foster! He is so sweet, so cuddly and so silly. He wants to be around his people whenever he can, if you're sitting on the couch he will definitely have his head or his whole body on top of you. He enjoys playtime, he loves fetch and tug of war. He is house broken and does all of his business outside! He walks super well, does not pull and does not react to other animals or people! Gusto is truly the sweetest dog and will make a wonderful best friend to the right family!

Gusto is a sweet-natured and loving dog who deserves a forever home. He acclimated to his new fosters, environment and surroundings relatively fast. He is potty trained and house broken, and never has had any accidents in the home. In terms of personality, he is silly, smart and just wants to cuddle with his human companions any chance he gets. He already knows some basic commands, but we've been training him on additional social skills and cues and he's learned within 3-4 days. He's been an absolute pleasure to have so far, and I can't wait to teach him more things so that he is ready to prance into his adopter's home soon!

🏡 My Ideal Home
Gusto is looking for an experienced adopter who can provide structure, daily exercise, and enrichment. An adult-only home would be best for this excitable pup, as he's still working on his manners and can get mouthy when overstimulated. Gusto would thrive with someone who's ready to channel his enthusiasm into fun training games, long walks, and lots of love.

🐕 Good with Other Dogs?
He's been non-reactive on walks and greeted dogs gently through the fence. Off-leash, he may avoid overly rowdy dogs, so he might enjoy a calm canine companion or prefer to be your one-and-only.

🦮 Leash Manners
Gusto starts out a little bouncy but generally walks well on leash. He'll happily prance by your side and check in frequently-and he's great at turning every walk into a little adventure.

🩺 Overall Health
Gusto is neutered, microchipped, and up to date on all vaccinations. He came in underweight but has gained healthy weight during his stay. He's been treated for occasional GI upset and skin sensitivities but is currently doing well.

🎉 One Fun Fact
A volunteer said it best: "Gusto's joy is contagious. Even on the grayest, coldest days, he'll remind you to find something
pets.description_html:
My foster writes: Gusto is the most curious pup I've ever met! He is always sniffing everything around him and he loves to explore! He also has the cutest little prance when we go on walks. His hips wag along with his tail and if you scratch his butt when he's walking he zooms along with his tail wagging. He is the gentlest dog i've ever met. When he takes a treat he sniffs it for a while before gently opening his mouth and taking it. He also loves to snuggle. You can hug him when he's laying with you and within minutes he'll be snoring louder than ever right in your ear! He is the best pup and I can't wait for him to have a forever home!

Gusto (210637) has been the perfect first foster! He is so sweet, so cuddly and so silly. He wants to be around his people whenever he can, if you're sitting on the couch he will definitely have his head or his whole body on top of you. He enjoys playtime, he loves fetch and tug of war. He is house broken and does all of his business outside! He walks super well, does not pull and does not react to other animals or people! Gusto is truly the sweetest dog and will make a wonderful best friend to the right family!

Gusto is a sweet-natured and loving dog who deserves a forever home. He acclimated to his new fosters, environment and surroundings relatively fast. He is potty trained and house broken, and never has had any accidents in the home. In terms of personality, he is silly, smart and just wants to cuddle with his human companions any chance he gets. He already knows some basic commands, but we've been training him on additional social skills and cues and he's learned within 3-4 days. He's been an absolute pleasure to have so far, and I can't wait to teach him more things so that he is ready to prance into his adopter's home soon!

🏡 My Ideal Home
Gusto is looking for an experienced adopter who can provide structure, daily exercise, and enrichment. An adult-only home would be best for this excitable pup, as he's still working on his manners and can get mouthy when overstimulated. Gusto would thrive with someone who's ready to channel his enthusiasm into fun training games, long walks, and lots of love.

🐕 Good with Other Dogs?
He's been non-reactive on walks and greeted dogs gently through the fence. Off-leash, he may avoid overly rowdy dogs, so he might enjoy a calm canine companion or prefer to be your one-and-only.

🦮 Leash Manners
Gusto starts out a little bouncy but generally walks well on leash. He'll happily prance by your side and check in frequently-and he's great at turning every walk into a little adventure.

🩺 Overall Health
Gusto is neutered, microchipped, and up to date on all vaccinations. He came in underweight but has gained healthy weight during his stay. He's been treated for occasional GI upset and skin sensitivities but is currently doing well.

🎉 One Fun Fact
A volunteer said it best: "Gusto's joy is contagious. Even on the grayest, coldest days, he'll remind you to find something

pets.name: Gypsum
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Sweet Gypsum! This loving girl, who came to us for nursing through a respiratory infection, has become more comfortable and loving each day. She is very fast learner-her house training has been nearly painless, and she has adapted with great ease to our daily walk schedule, making full use of her time both to take care of herself, which she does efficiently and promptly, and to count the squirrels in Central Park. Her tail wags so fast that it becomes a blur, and she puts her hind quarters into it as well, greeting people and dogs with absolutely no worries that the world will not love her back. The doormen in our neighborhood step outside to greet her as she stands happily peering in at them, her tail ablaze. She really likes men! And men like her back. She's also SO eager to play with the other dogs-she bows down and sets the tail on "fast" mode when she sees one coming. She sleeps through the night without stirring from her little bed on the floor next to me. We haven't heard her bark once. When fireworks went off for a long display before the NYC Marathon, she didn't even look up. She seems comfortable, secure, and just glad to be here. She has learned "sit" very quickly, and we are working on her one questionable habit, an exuberant hug that can come on just a little too strong, especially with that tail going full force. She's already greeting most people from a sit instead of a climb and with her quick learning skills, we think she will move past this insecurity. She does require about 15 minutes of daily belly rub time, while she tells you how much she loves you, and then she konks out for a long nap. She's energetic, strong, loving and zesty, and would make a fantastic running buddy.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I am playful and cute!

A Volunteer Wrote: Each of us likes to believe Gypsum loves us the most, but we have to admit she has been endlessly generous with her love since she first arrived! She wags her tail at absolutely everyone, and where most dogs enter the shelter scared (who could blame them?), the staff member who greeted her described her immediately as "incredibly friendly and seeking affection." Gypsum loves to greet her walkers with a hug before the outdoor adventures begin, during which she shows off her great training and leash manners. Gypsum is a heart-melter waiting to work her magic on you! My boroughbreaker writes: Gypsum wants to greet every person and dog she sees! Not in an aggressive, demanding way, but rather in a hopeful, "if I wag my tail hard enough, maybe they'll let me say hi" way. Everyone LOVED her, and she got tons of pets and skritches. We walked around the park for five hours, and not once did she pull on her leash, or bark at another person or animal.

pets.name: Hachiko
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

pets.name: Harper
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: I'm Harper, the sweetest girl you'll meet. I enjoy being by your side and make the best companion. I'm good on the leash and will listen when you call my name even if I'm distracted by other dogs. I enjoy laying on the couch and riding in the car. I need to be the only dog in the house. With my foster I've learned to stop jumping on people when I'm excited. I'm eager to learn and brush up on my manners through positive reinforcement. I enjoy lots of attention and praise. I would make a great family dog.

My #BoroughBreak Buddy Writes: On my borough break yesterday, I had the pleasure of spending the day with this amazing soul. She enjoys walks in the park, car rides, takes treats gently. Harper also is leash trained and walks by your side with minimal to no pulling. Throughout the entire time we were with her, she never showed any signs of aggressive behavior towards adults and children. It was easy for us to get her in and out of my car. She enjoyed the ride and was very relaxed. She is house broken and will let you know when she needs to go out. As an added bonus she loved to give kisses.  Harper is the perfect embodiment of warmth and affection. Her love for people and her gentle nature shine brightly. With such a loving personality, Harper surely brings light into every room she enters. Her forever home will be so lucky to welcome her.

Oh my gosh, I LOVED HARPER! She is truly an incredible dog. When she first came out of her kennel, she was shy and hesitant to leave the shelter, but the second we got in the car and headed to McDonald's (she's a HUGE fan of chicken nuggets and fries!), she completely came out of her shell.
We visited two different parks and walked over 4 miles together. Her tail never stopped wagging, and for about half the walk she proudly carried a toy in her mouth. She was an absolute love bug, soaking up pets, leaning her whole body into me, and just wanting affection.
We passed tons of dogs throughout the day; she'd glance at them but was super easy to redirect with a kissing noise or a treat. She loved greeting people too, and was so polite at Petco, she literally stood in line and waited her turn like a little lady.
Harper really is such a wonderful dog. I hope someone gives her the chance she deserves, because she is a completely different dog outside the shelter. It absolutely broke my heart bringing her back especially because she didn't want to walk to her kennel until I walked with her.

Harper first came to us via police 3 years ago when they found her wandering the streets. She was returned to her guardian not too long after that. Most recently, she was found again as a stray by a good samaritan in August. She has been quite the toy connoisseur with staff too, parading and tossing her toys around the room. During her greet with a female dog, she had a soft frame and wagging tail. She approached the other dog gently and creates distance when she becomes uncomfortable.

pets.name: Haven
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet needs emergency placement. Please click here to go to our emergency placement page for more information.

This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Haven is at risk due to her behavioral concerns. Haven was lunging and barking at another dog while returning from a walk when she redirected and bit an handler in the stomach. The bite did not break skin but caused bruising through multiple layers of clothing. She was returned to her kennel without further issue. Haven has a pattern of heightened arousal and reactivity around other dogs. She becomes easily overstimulated by movement, sounds, and nearby dogs, and she has displayed anxiety, vocalizing, and escalating arousal. While Haven is social and affiliative with people-often loose, wiggly, and responsive to training. Medically Haven is healthy. Previous owner states Haven is a social, affectionate, very active and playful dog who spends most of her time wherever her people are in the home but can also be found in the bedroom or living room of the home. She is accustomed to going on 2-3 walks a day for 30mins to an hour at a time during which she pull on her leash. She loves car rides, cuddles and chasing her tail. Se knows the cues sit, stay, down, and if you give her a treat and say "boop" she will press her nose to your hand. Haven loves snacking on chicken but is not picky with treats.

pets.name: Hercules
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Hercules came into the care center as an owner surrender. His owners had him for 5 months due to finding him abandoned at their workplace. Due to his size and destructive tendencies, they are unable to keep him long term. They noted that he is a social, affectionate, active, playful, quite, lazy, independent, dog. He spends most of his time where people are, in the bedroom, in the kitchen, and in the living room. In the care center, he has shown fearful behaviors such as a tucked tail, whale eyes and will headwhip when touched. While he will approach handlers and gently take treats, he quickly becomes conflicted and stiffens, indicating discomfort with close contact. Hercules will benefit from a patient, low-pressure environment that allows him to build trust at his own pace. Hercules is available for rescue through one of our new hope partners.

Hercules will benefit from a patient, low-pressure environment that allows him to build trust at his own pace. Hercules is available for rescue through one of our new hope partners.
pets.description: This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response. Pre-Screener Form Hercules came into the care center as an owner surrender. His owners had him for 5 months due to finding him abandoned at their workplace. Due to his size and destructive tendencies, they are unable to keep him long term. They noted that he is a social, affectionate, active, playful, quite, lazy, independent, dog. He spends most of his time where people are, in the bedroom, in the kitchen, and in the living room. In the care center, he has shown fearful behaviors such as a tucked tail, whale eyes and will headwhip when touched. While he will approach handlers and gently take treats, he quickly becomes conflicted and stiffens, indicating discomfort with close contact. Hercules will benefit from a patient, low-pressure environment that allows him to build trust at his own pace.  Hercules is available for rescue through one of our new hope partners.

pets.name: Immogen
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Meet Immogen aka Cinnamon! 🌸 Immogen is a 6-year-old sweetheart with the softest fur, the squishiest face, and a heart full of love. She's an affectionate, snuggly girl who would be thrilled to share your couch or bed-though she's also a polite lady who listens when told "no." She's incredibly smart and has quickly learned the household rules. Immogen gets along well with both dogs and cats. A perfect mix of calm and playful, Immogen is always up for a game with her toys when you're ready, but she's just as happy to nap quietly nearby while you work or relax. She's strong and sometimes forgets her own strength, but she's gentle at heart and eager to please. Though it seems she's had puppies in the past, Immogen still has some adorable puppy-like tendencies that will melt your heart. She's friendly with everyone she meets and would make a loving, loyal companion for anyone lucky enough to bring her home. If you're looking for a cuddle bug with a playful spirit and a heart of gold, Immogen is your girl. 💕

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

pets.name: Indigo
pets.summaryHtml:
My Boroughbreaker writes: Indigo is obedient, gentle, quiet and loves the car window down and the wind blowing on his face. He's fun and active guy so he perfect for a full adventure outside. Indoors he's playful and cuddly, He is not toy aggressive and is gentle with taking snacks out of the hand. He pulls on the lead but with verbal corrections he listens. He will be best paired with an active and confident person. He's a wonderful boy with so much love to share, anyone will be lucky to have him in their family.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

pets.name: Jaguar
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

A Volunteer Wrote: Hanging out with this amazing dog led to making a new friend with the person on the bench next to me--he's so joyful he makes his walkers joyful, which makes us want to pass that joy onto others-and everyone wants to talk about what a good boy he is! He's a human connector, and while it was noted that he was dog reactive when he arrived in the shelter, in our dog-filled park time he did nothing but wag his tail and ignore the other passing dogs, including one who would have been happy to start an argument. Jaguar is the kind of company--kind, enthusiastically affectionate, and just happy to be along for the ride--that made us wish we could have spent hours with him. Imagine that he could be yours for a lifetime! Please come meet him at MACC.

pets.name: Jam
pets.summaryHtml:
Jammy Jam! While her past is a mystery it doesn't matter, Jam lives in the moment and has a pure zest for life. She's a senior gal but that doesn't slow her down. Jam's number one request is to be with her human. She'll wake up on your schedule and wait patiently for her favorite time of day, her morning walk! She does the most adorable tippy taps to show her excitement! On our walks Jam is excellent on a leash and polite with people and other dogs. She's been playful with dogs on leash so she may even do well with a doggy sibling! After our walk, it's time to play with toys or snooze in the sun in the yard. This loving and affection girl will wiggle her way into your heart as soon as you meet her and her unique look will make you fall in love! My foster writes: Jam is truly man's best friend. Everywhere you go she wants to come with you radiating joy and gratitude that she's invited. She has the biggest smile and softest eyes. Walks will take 15 minutes longer because everyone will stop to tell you how cute your dog is. She can be a little impatient because she just wants to go from one adventure right into the next and she can struggle with separation anxiety when left alone. But it's all because she loves you and just wants to be with you 24/7. If you want a fiercely loyal companion who never takes for granted all that you do for her then Jam is the dog for you. There is an adorable video of me on social media! Click here to experience the cuteness!
🏠 My Ideal Home Jam would thrive with an adopter who appreciates her zest for life and can support her with enrichment, exercise, and structure. She's energetic for her age and loves to learn, so a home that can offer mental stimulation and force-free training will help her shine. Jam has some special medical needs, so a compassionate adopter willing to provide ongoing care is essential. A quieter home where she can be your one-and-only-or carefully introduced to other respectful dogs-would be ideal. 🐶 Good with Other Dogs? Jam has had a variety of playgroup experiences at the shelter-sometimes playful and bouncy, other times overstimulated or reactive depending on the dog. She's been used as a greeter dog and shown appropriate social skills, but also needs space when she's had enough. With the right match and slow intros, she may do well with a mellow companion. 🐾 Leash Manners Jam walks with mild to moderate pulling and can become reactive to other dogs on leash, especially in high-traffic areas. A front-clip harness and reward-based redirection are recommended. She's been working hard with our behavior team and shows great progress when engaged in training games like the "123" or "Take A Breath" exercises.

pets.name: Jazzy J
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Since arriving at the care centers, Jazzy J has expressed a fearful disposition and has shown clear signs of discomfort with handler, becoming visibly tense and avoiding handlers when attempting to leash him. During his intake he escalated to growling and bearing teeth toward handlers. While on walks Jazzy is hypervigilant and fearful of people passing him on the street. We recommend placement with a New Hope rescue partner who is able to provide an experienced, adult-only foster home. Force-free, reward based training and/or consultation with a professional trainer/behaviorist is highly recommended.

pets.name: Joan
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Joan is the best girl. She loves humans, dogs, treats and long walks on the beach. Her love language is quality time, so beware, she will want to stay by your side all day long-she would do best with a human who understands her attachment style and who works from home or can spend tons (and tons) of time with her.

pets.name: John The Baptiste
pets.summaryHtml:
This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

John arrived at MACC as an owner surrender, his previous owner describes him as a playful dog. During his assessment John was obsvered to rush towards the assess-a-hand and bite and hold it. He remained tense and hovered over the toy in his possession. John was obsvered obsvered to be highly anxious. Noted to be panting and pacing throughout the assessment. Due to the detailed behavior we recommend an experienced adult only home.

pets.name: Jonny
pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

A volunteer writes: Jonny was found with 8 dogs crated in an apartment alone. Jonny appreciates being spoken too in a soft voice, and cheese. Because Jonny was found alone in the apartment, we don't have any information about his life previously other than he lived with many dogs. We do know he is a very cute little guy with a funny face. He's extra furry and has the hint of a chow chow in his purple spotted tongue! He has been a tad of a nervous guy, but more recently he has gotten used to his new friends and props himself into laps! He's a soft cuddly guy who is perfect for the chilly fall nights coming soon.

pets.name: Kassy
pets.summaryHtml:
My foster writes: Kassy is the perfect combo of chill + playful. She will happily lounge on her bed all day (although she would love to go to a home where she can cuddle on the couch) or go on an ice long walk and play. Whatever you're in the mood for, she is ready! She did great on hikes and stayed alongside us and loved to explore the water (fetching leaves and splashing around). She is great with other animals and children (she lives with a foster cat now, and she is great with my son)! She would make a great companion for a single person or a family. She is VERY affectionate and loyal. She loves belly rubs and will lay very still on her back to ask for rubs. She will check in on you while you're in the bathroom and grunt when there is a noise at the door. This sweet girl would love to find her forever home! A volunteer writes: Kassy is a total sweetheart, easygoing and fun-loving! She has the playfulness of a puppy and the good manners of a calm, stable dog who just wants to be your best friend. Anyone who gives her kindness (and belly rubs!) would get an amazing companion in return.

Please check here for updated adoption hours.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I am finding the shelter a bit overwhelming. Outside one-on-one I am a great big cuddle bug.

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I prefer to call the shots and enjoy coming to you when I'm ready for pets.

I am playful and cute!

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

pets.name: Ken
pets.summaryHtml:
Ken is a playful and driven pup enrolled in our Shelter Scholars program, where he's working on developing trust and confidence when it comes to toy guarding. Through consistent training and reward-based strategies, Ken is learning to share his favorite things without stress. He's making encouraging progress as he learns that good things come from calm cooperation.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

I love to be loved, but on my own terms! Let's brush up on some canine body language together!

pets.name: Khloe
pets.summaryHtml:
The foster writes: Khloe is a blonde cutie with an infectious smile! She loves being around her humans in our apartment and snoozes on the bed or couch when we work from home. Waking up with Khloe is magical, she likes to wake us up with kisses as a way to say she is ready for her morning walk. When she sees her leash come out we often get a "happy howl." She enjoys her walks and sniffing everything the sidewalk has to offer. She's learned to like toys as well as chasing a tennis ball off leash in an enclosed area without other dogs. On walks outside, certain people or scenarios will trigger her reactivity but she's improved greatly while with us and working with a trainer. Once she warms up to new people at home she'll often engage them for pets or bring them a toy to play with her. She would do best in a home with a large enclosed yard for playing, daily walks and someone who will continue working with her on her reactive triggers. She will need to be the sole pet in the home and without young children.

Khloe's foster got a DNA test done for her. Click here to see her results!

pets.name: King
pets.summaryHtml:
My Foster Writes: Hi! I'm King. I love a good snuggle on a comfy couch, and playing with any round object that resembles a ball. I know sit, down, and I just learned paw! Happy to snore next to you while you work from home, or keep you warm during a midday nap.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I am playful and cute!

I will need daily physical activity to keep me healthy and happy!

pets.name: King Milo
pets.summaryHtml:
King Milo is a bright and focused pup participating in our Shelter Scholars program, where he's learning to feel more relaxed and secure around food. By using trust-building routines and positive reinforcement, he's beginning to understand that he doesn't need to guard his meals to keep them. Each session helps him build confidence and practice calmer behavior around his food bowl.

What my friends at ACC say about me:

I'm ready to learn! I need a patient person who has the time to work on training with me.

I don't always like to share my food, toys or bedding with other animals.

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

I would do best in a home with only adult humans.

pets.summaryHtml:
This pet is available only through ACC New Hope partners. To adopt or foster, please complete the pre-screener form below. Inquiries sent directly to ACC will not receive a response.

Pre-Screener Form

Kira arrived at MACC as an owner surrender. During her stay in the care center Kira has been obsvered to be highly fearful. Noted to have a tense body and retreat from the handler when approached. Due to the detailed behavior we recommend an experienced adult only home.

pets.name: Koda
pets.summaryHtml:
Koda's adoption fee has been generously sponsored! Submit an application today to learn more about her! My foster writes: Koda is a happy, affectionate girl who knows how to balance playtime and downtime. The second you walk in the door, she's on her back with her belly up, ready for rubs, and attention. She's just as content watching TV at your side as she is exploring the neighborhood on a sniff-filled walk, or entertaining herself with toys. She's also incredibly smart and food-motivated (especially with peanut butter, but she hasn't met a snack she doesn't like!). Already clicker-trained and housebroken, she knows sit, stay, leave it, her name, and even advanced cues to help her focus and disengage when needed. With her love of treats and eagerness to please, the sky's the limit for what she can learn next. Her routine is easy - a morning, evening, and bedtime walk - and she does great when left alone while I'm at the office. She's never met a stranger and soaks up attention from everyone. At home, she loves sticking her nose out the window to feel the breeze, and she handles stairs with ease, making her a great fit for a walk-up apartment. She's currently working with a trainer on her reactivity to other dogs, and she's already made tremendous progress. She's a quick study who responds beautifully to guidance, and she'll thrive in a home excited to continue her training journey. If you're looking for a sweet, trainable, and adaptable companion who will happily be your shadow, cuddle buddy, and walking partner, Koda can't wait to meet you. My foster writes: Koda is so sweet she just might give you diabetes! This cuddle bug loves nothing more than snuggling up and snoozing next to you on the couch. Koda is a great companion outside of the house too - she'll walk at your pace, as leisurely or as briskly as you would like. Koda makes friends with everyone she meets; she's an adorable, gentle, curious, open-hearted, wiggly good girl. Koda is super smart and loves her treats so she'll be able to pick up any new trick you'd like to teach her. She'll be your most loyal friend from the minute you take her home... come meet Koda today!!

What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

I would appreciate slow introductions to new people and places to help me feel safe.

I need a home without cats or small animals.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I'm sensitive and shy. I'll need extra help from you.

I love getting pets and - you guessed it - snuggles!

I will need daily physical activity to keep me healthy and happy!

pets.summaryHtml:
What my friends at ACC say about me:

My history is a mystery and my friends here do not know much about me yet!

It is unknown if I have ever lived with other animals or children.

I would do best in a home without very tiny humans, although I could be open to older human children once I meet them.

I am playful and cute!

I love to play and will need appropriate toys and positive outlets for my energy.

pets.name: Ladybird
pets.summaryHtml:
🐾 Meet Ladybird Ladybird came to us in the middle of the night, after her owner was unexpectedly arrested and there was no one left to care for her. Officers brought her to ACC, and she arrived trembling, unsure, and completely alone. At just 3 years old, this medium-sized sweetheart is trying her best to navigate an overwhelming world-and she's looking for a patient, loving adopter who can help her rediscover safety and trust. 🏡 My Ideal Home Ladybird is searching for a calm, quiet home where she can take her time settling in. A routine, peaceful environment without a lot of hustle and bustle will help her feel safe. She'd do best with someone who understands that the best relationships are built slowly-and that every small win is worth celebrating. 👶 Good with Kids? Ladybird should not live with very young children. She may be open to older, respectful kids who can give her space and allow her to approach on her own terms. 🐕 Good with Other Dogs? Ladybird has shown fearful body language around other dogs in the care center and may be uncomfortable in social settings with them. She'd likely thrive as the only pet. 🦮 Leash Manners She walks gently on leash but may dart away from loud noises or unfamiliar sights. With a secure harness and lots of reassurance, she'll build confidence over time. 🩺 Overall Health Ladybird is a healthy 46-pound pup. She is not yet spayed but has been vaccinated, microchipped, and treated for common preventives. 🧠 Behavior Determination: Level 2 Ladybird is shy and anxious in the shelter environment. While she allows gentle handling, she often keeps her distance and watches the world with wide, uncertain eyes. With time and positive reinforcement, we believe she can blossom into a devoted companion. 💸 Adoption Fee: $75 Ladybird is ready to trade in her uncertainty for comfort. If you're someone who believes in second chances and quiet triumphs, come meet this tender-hearted girl. She may be timid now, but with your help, she could learn to fly. 🐞

My Foster wrote:This young pittie girl is bursting with love, energy, and personality! Whether she's tossing her toys in the air or trotting happily on long walks. Ladybird lives for playtime and time with her favorite humans. Ladybird didn't get the socialization or training she deserved in her early days, but she's a fast learner with the right person and plenty of structure. She's working hard on her manners and gaining confidence every day! At the moment, she's reactive to other dogs and needs to be the only pup in your home, but with the right support we are hopeful that she may be able to have dog friends in the future. For now, she wants you all to herself! What Ladybird needs: * A dog- and cat-free home * A committed, patient human to continue her training * Daily exercise + playtime * Couch privileges (non-negotiable) In return, you'll get unconditional love, soulful eyes staring up at you, and the best snuggle buddy in the five boroughs.
